intro: Rosa gallica f. fejerdensis, commonly known as the Fejérden rose, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to Central Europe. It features dense, thorned stems and fragrant, semi-double pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has dark green, oval-shaped leaves with serrated edges, and its flowers are typically borne singly or in small clusters. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical significance in horticulture.
